title: Vector Representation
text: A vector is represented by each of its components, which are denoted by the $$x_1$$ and the $$x_2$$ stacked in a column formation. The $$x_1$$ is the first component and the $$x_2$$ is the second component.

title: Standard Basis Vectors
text: The first standard basis vector $$e_1$$ has a $$1$$ in the first component, and zeroes in all other components. The place of the $$1$$ corresponds to the number of the basis vector.

title: Evaluating the Function
text: To evaluate the function, plug in the first and second components of the standard basis vectors that correspond to $$x_1$$ and $$x_2$$.

title: Recognizing Components
text: To calculate the function at the first standard basis vector, what is the result when $$1$$ is plugged in as $$x_1$$ and $$0$$ is plugged in as $$x_2$$?

title: Domain and Range
text: The f:R**2->R specifies that the input value is two dimensional and the return value should be one dimensional (a single number).

title: Negative Standard Basis Vectors
text: To find the negative of the standard basis vectors, multiply each of the components by $$-1$$.
